content:
Diagnosis:	Stage IV right upper lobe adenocarcinoma with solitary brain metastasis
	Initial diagnosis January 2023 - T1cN0M0
	Progression with brain metastasis noted August 2023
	EGFR mutation positive with C797S resistance mutation detected March 2024

I reviewed [redacted name] today in the lung oncology clinic. She has been on osimertinib 80mg daily since February 2023 for EGFR-positive lung adenocarcinoma, initially with excellent response. Unfortunately, surveillance imaging in August 2023 detected a solitary right parietal brain metastasis, treated with stereotactic radiosurgery (15Gy single fraction) with good local control.

Recent molecular testing from liquid biopsy has confirmed emergence of EGFR C797S resistance mutation. Her most recent CT chest (March 15 2024) shows stable appearances of the primary lesion measuring 2.1cm, and MRI brain (March 20 2024) confirms continued response of the treated metastasis with no new intracranial disease.

Clinically she remains well with PS 1. She describes occasional mild headaches but no focal neurological symptoms. She continues to work part-time and maintains good activity levels. Chest examination today was unremarkable.

Given the emergence of resistance mutation but clinically and radiologically stable disease, we have discussed treatment options in detail at lung MDT. The consensus recommendation is to continue osimertinib for now with close monitoring, given the lack of significant progression and good tolerability. We will repeat imaging in 6 weeks and consider clinical trial options if there is evidence of progression. I have arranged follow-up in 6 weeks with repeat CT chest/abdomen/pelvis and MRI brain.

primary_cancer.biomarker_status: EGFR mutation positive with C797S resistance mutation

cancer_timeline.value: Detection of solitary right parietal brain metastasis
Stereotactic radiosurgery to brain metastasis, 15Gy single fraction
Liquid biopsy confirms EGFR C797S resistance mutation
CT chest shows stable primary lesion measuring 2.1cm
MRI brain confirms continued response of treated metastasis, no new disease

patient_facts.value: Occasional mild headaches, no focal neurological symptoms
Continues to work part-time and maintains good activity levels

status_updates.value: EGFR-positive lung adenocarcinoma with treated brain metastasis, clinically stable but developed resistance mutation
Continue osimertinib 80mg daily with close monitoring despite resistance mutation
Repeat CT chest/abdomen/pelvis and MRI brain in 6 weeks
Follow-up in lung oncology clinic in 6 weeks with imaging
